lpool.logic

Class BodyEditorLoader

  • java.lang.Object
    • lpool.logic.BodyEditorLoader

  • public class BodyEditorLoader
extends java.lang.Object
    Loads the collision fixtures defined with the Physics Body Editor application. You only need to give it a body and the corresponding fixture name, and it will attach these fixtures to your body.
    Author:
    Aurelien Ribon | http://www.aurelienribon.com

    • Method Detail

      • attachFixture

        public void attachFixture(com.badlogic.gdx.physics.box2d.Body body,
                          java.lang.String name,
                          com.badlogic.gdx.physics.box2d.FixtureDef fd,
                          float scale)
        Creates and applies the fixtures defined in the editor. The name parameter is used to retrieve the right fixture from the loaded file.

        The body reference point (the red cross in the tool) is by default located at the bottom left corner of the image. This reference point will be put right over the BodyDef position point. Therefore, you should place this reference point carefully to let you place your body in your world easily with its BodyDef.position point. Note that to draw an image at the position of your body, you will need to know this reference point (see getOrigin(java.lang.String, float).

        Also, saved shapes are normalized. As shown in the tool, the width of the image is considered to be always 1 meter. Thus, you need to provide a scale factor so the polygons get resized according to your needs (not every body is 1 meter large in your game, I guess).
        Parameters:
        body - The Box2d body you want to attach the fixture to.
        name - The name of the fixture you want to load.
        fd - The fixture parameters to apply to the created body fixture.
        scale - The desired scale of the body. The default width is 1.

      • getImagePath

        public java.lang.String getImagePath(java.lang.String name)
        Gets the image path attached to the given name.

      • getOrigin

        public com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2 getOrigin(java.lang.String name,
                                               float scale)
        Gets the origin point attached to the given name. Since the point is normalized in [0,1] coordinates, it needs to be scaled to your body size. Warning: this method returns the same Vector2 object each time, so copy it if you need it for later use.

      • getInternalModel

        public BodyEditorLoader.Model getInternalModel()
        For advanced users only. Lets you access the internal model of this loader and modify it. Be aware that any modification is permanent and that you should really know what you are doing.
